Hello!

I'm a Data Science master student at Worcester Polytechnic Institute set to graduate in May of 2018.

My main interest is to understand real-world demands rooted in various applications from a data-scientist-specific perspective, to create models that could utilize existing data with higher efficency, to find key features that descript the system more significantly, and to solve challenges by achieving better performance and with lower risk.

As graduate student in data science major, my study and work experence have solified my skill sets firmly, which includes novel machine learning techniques like neural network and reinforcement learning; big data management/analysis tools like hadoop, spark, mongoDB, MySQL, etc. Besides, I am experienced in multiple programing styles like objective-oriented (OOP), imperative (IP) and functional programming (FP), etc.Through years of practice, I have grown my understanding how these tools' strengths and limitaions affect their adoptions for various real-world applications.

Currently, I am working in Pfizer as data scientist intern to help Pfizer find the pain point on the rise of R&D costs for the clinical trail. I believe that, with the power of data, we can find a effective way to control the costs, reduce waste, and to improve R&D efficiency

During my free time, i enjoy music, photography, cooking, coffee and cocoa.


Experience

Data scientist intern Pfizer Cost control 17-Present
